medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports sudden onset pain lasting several hours in the RUQ and epigastric regions, with radiation to the back. The pain is described as sharp, dull, and crampy, with an intermittent return. Patient experienced chills yesterday and subjective fevers. There was no relation to food intake. There has been decreased food intake over the last 2 days and the patient has been NPO since midnight. Patient also reports 3 episodes of non-bloody, non-bilious vomiting of stomach contents over the past several days.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with breast cancer and deceased from acute myelogenous leukemia. Aunt with pancreatic cancer.
